tags: and i won't change my mind.
body:
Critical Role ep 108

And this is why you never send hate to anyone. Because, as much as she jokes about it, you can tell that Marisha’s very aware that people will analyze her every move just to be horrible to her. The little comment about knowing that the chat is probably commenting “thanks Keyleth” after she created a cloud of fog in the room made me feel so bad for her.

reblog.comment:
Critical Role ep 108

summary: My Mollymauk cosplay placed 2nd in a cosplay contest! The prize money was enough to help me buy up all of the clearance flowers...
body: My Mollymauk cosplay placed 2nd in a cosplay contest! The prize money was enough to help me buy up all of the clearance flowers at the local craft store so that I could make flower crowns to give out at Dragon Con this weekend! I am so excited, I love bringing prizes for little kids and critters I meet at cons, it is my favorite thing in the world!! I can’t wait to see you all there! I’ll be the Mollymauk with all of the flowers and the big stupid grin, follow the jingling of my horn jewelry and you’ll find me. :P

I’ll be the Mollymauk with all of the flowers and the big stupid grin, follow the jingling of my horn jewelry and you’ll find me. :P

I’ll be the Mollymauk with all of the flowers and the big stupid grin, follow the jingling of my horn jewelry and you’ll find me. :P

summary: I am still very slowly working my way through campaign 1, and I just finished episode 40, and that was fine. Everything is fine....
body:
I am still very slowly working my way through campaign 1, and I just finished episode 40, and that was fine. Everything is fine. No one is crying here.

“Do not go far from me.” 😭😭😭

title: DnD Backstory Time - Redemption “Reed” Kosvir
body:
(Before I start this story, a little background. Since I’m getting really into DnD lately, and since I’ve been starting to follow a bunch of DnD blogs, I figure I’d like to contribute to this awesome community. So this will be a daily? or weekly? thing where I post a backstory for one of my DnD/Pathfinder characters. Prefacing each one with the type of campaign the character in question was made for. This one I’m really excited about so I’m starting with him.)

Preface: Reed was made for my friend’s 5e Tal’dorei campaign, based out of the Tal’dorei Campaign Setting of Matthew Mercer and Friends’ amazing show Critical Role. Reed is a Tiefling Druid, because I’ve been sitting on this idea for the longest time. He was initially gonna be a Druid of the Circle of Twilight, but my DM won’t allow for Unearthed Arcana, so I’m still trying to figure out what I want his Circle to be. Anyway, this is Reed’s story.


In Vesrah, where the Druidic people of the Water Ashari tribe reside, there is a tradition passed down through the generations from the different elemental tribes of Ashari known as an Aramenté. This is a grueling and unforgiving task that rewards those who under take it with power and knowledge beyond normal comprehension. Each tribe sends their own representatives once every generation; however, the daunting task is rarely completed due to the dangers that come with completing each tribe’s task; which requires that the Ashari in question enter the portal to the Elemental Plane and complete a certain ritual or retrieve an item. In Vesrah, you are tasked with entering the Plane of Water and retrieving several lodestones from the lair of a Kraken. This is where Redemption’s story begins.

               Redemption’s father, Sigwald, was chosen from his generation to be sent from Vesrah on his Aramenté; Sigwald was an accomplished druid, however, even he had his doubts as to whether or not he could complete this task. The night before he was to begin his trial in the Plane of Water, he took time to ask for guidance and strength in this trial, calling out to the Aether. If only he had called upon a more specific power. In his home a beautiful woman with glowing lavender skin suddenly appeared, offering him the assistance he required under the guise of a herald of The Wildmother; Melora. Sigwald would know nothing of her true form until the end of his days, he accepted this assistance happily. The mysterious woman drew some of his essence from his being and replaced it with some of her own, giving him the power he requested. With ease, Sigwald was able to make his way through his trial and even the next, visiting the land of the Wind Ashari; Zephrah. However, his third task would be his downfall.

               Sigwald arrived in Pyrah and began his trial, entering the Plane of Fire. No one is quite sure what happened, but after an hour Sigwald was found dead, his body charred and withered. As news reached Vesrah of Sigwald’s fate, a mysterious infant would be found among the reeds near Sigwald’s home. This child bore pale lavender skin, pitch black hair, yellow eyes, and a small set of dark purple horns. This is the child that would be known as Redemption Kosvir. Like most Tieflings, Reed was left with the innate knowledge of how he came into existence, he alone knew his father’s dark deal; and he alone knew what really happened to him. His “mother”, a demon named Yuvari, was the woman who came to Sigwald that night. Learning of the power an Ashari would receive after completing their Aramenté, Yuvari’s lust for this power and knowledge led her to her decision that it must be hers. So, when Sigwald reached the Plane of Fire; a plane closely connected to the Nine Hells; she used this time to kill him.

               Reed was created from the combination of his father’s desperation, and his “mother’s” lust for power; Yuvari knew she couldn’t infiltrate the Water Ashari herself, but perhaps she wouldn’t need to. A child is all that would be required, a child that she could use as a vessel for this power she craved so desperately. Through years of careful manipulation, when Reed came of age; he was chosen for his own Aramenté and with no one the wiser; Yuvari allowed Reed to make quick work of the Trial of Water. Before Reed left Vesrah to continue his journey, he decided he would take on the virtue of Redemption; when asked why by the current Heart of the Tides, he simply smiled and said “Redeeming those who have fallen in pursuit of this ancient tradition. It, seems fitting, no?” Not wanting to reveal his true reasoning, to redeem his father’s sins and in doing so, making sure that his mother never received the power of a fully awakened Ashari. By any means necessary.

blog.name: sandssavvy
blog.title: Where fandoms collide
blog.description:
I am a giant geek so there will be a lot of fandom posts. However I will also reblog a lot of current events, social justice, etc. I also have some old rp blogs. I am white, dyadic, genderfluid (she or they pronouns), and asexual biromantic. I intend for this blog to be queer positive, trans positive, anti-racism, and intersectionally feminist.

Please let me know if you need any specific trigger warnings if you follow me. I try to trigger warn for any content about rape with "rape culture", "rape", or "tw:rape" also I tag "gifs" or "Gif set" for anyone with epilepsy

My Archive of Our Own fanfic page.

My youtube account

It is mainly full of Critical Role compilation vids and cosplay vids.

and my Ko-fi is here.

In case you would like to support me.

Tumblr posts of my vids are here

summary: The Mighty Nein find out who had the best dick Jester's ever seen. Bryce is overwhelmed by The Mighty Nein's nonsense. Caleb...
caption:
The Mighty Nein find out who had the best dick Jester’s ever seen. Bryce is overwhelmed by The Mighty Nein’s nonsense.
Caleb checks in to make sure Jester’s childhood wasn’t messed up. Since she was just a mischievous kid, we can all enjoy this fully.
Caleb’s egg McMuffin comment is about Mollymauk covering giving himself a fake STD with egg and makeup in the hospital chaos ep.
This is how Molly would want to be remembered.

Footage from Critical Role Campaign 2 Episode 32: “Beyond the Boundaries”

Subscribe if you want to see more of my Critical Role compilation vids as they are released.

summary: what’s the funniest thing about a member of the cr cast?
question: what’s the funniest thing about a member of the cr cast?
answer: Any time something happens that causes Travis Willingham to get over excited or lose his mind laughing and you can’t comprehend what he’s saying is truly a blessing.
